content: Uranyl acetate (0.25 mmol, 106 mg), pyridine-2,5-dicarboxylic acid (H2PDC) (0.50 mmol, 84 mg), and 0.5 mL aqueous sodium bicarbonate (pH 8.5) were combined in a 9 mm glass tube and flame sealed under vacuum. The tube was heated to 80 °C, held for 12 h, heated to 190 °C, held for 3 days, cooled to 80 °C, held for 12 h, and finally cooled to room temperature. Crystals of 1 formed under autogenous pressure as yellow needles in quantitative yield based on stoichiometric ratio.
clean_text:
Hydrothermal Synthesis of Na2(H2O)2UO2(PDC)2 (1)

Uranyl acetate (0.25 mmol, 106 mg), pyridine-2,5-dicarboxylic acid (H2PDC) (0.50 mmol, 84 mg), and 0.5 mL aqueous sodium bicarbonate (pH 8.5) were combined in a 9 mm glass tube and flame sealed under vacuum. The tube was heated to 80 °C, held for 12 h, heated to 190 °C, held for 3 days, cooled to 80 °C, held for 12 h, and finally cooled to room temperature. Crystals of 1 formed under autogenous pressure as yellow needles in quantitative yield based on stoichiometric ratio.
